dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.greetingFieldWorker: Here are your assignments for today.
dashboard.greetingViewer: Here is a snapshot of current activity.
dashboard.welcomeMessage: Start by creating your first project, adding bank accounts, or inviting team members. Your KPIs, charts, and activity feed will populate automatically as you add data.
dashboard.insightCashBelowPayablesDesc: Cash ({cash}) does not cover outstanding payables ({payables}). Accelerate collections or arrange bridge financing.
dashboard.insightCashReservesTighteningDesc: Cash covers {ratio}x of outstanding payables ({payables}). Monitor closely and consider accelerating receivable collections.
dashboard.insightHighReceivablesDesc: {amount} in outstanding receivables. Follow up on aging invoices to improve cash flow.
dashboard.insightScheduleBelowTargetDesc: Average completion across active projects is {percent}. Review project timelines and resource allocation.
dashboard.insightScheduleNeedsAttentionDesc: Average completion is {percent}. Projects are progressing -- monitor for delays on critical path items.
dashboard.insightHighChangeOrdersDesc: {count} open change orders pending review. Consider scheduling a dedicated review session to clear the backlog.
dashboard.insightProjectsOnHoldDesc: On-hold projects may tie up committed resources and affect cash flow forecasting. Review for reactivation or closure.
dashboard.insightApprovalBacklogDesc: {count} items awaiting approval. Delayed approvals can bottleneck subcontractor payments and project progress.
dashboard.insightStrongScheduleDesc: Projects are averaging {percent} completion. Team execution is on track -- consider pursuing new opportunities.
dashboard.insightStrongCashDesc: Cash reserves ({cash}) provide {ratio}x coverage of outstanding obligations.
dashboard.insightAllNormalDesc: No critical issues detected. Continue monitoring your projects and financials from this dashboard.

financial.jobCostingDesc: Track costs by CSI division with earned value metrics.
financial.noBudgetLinesJobCostingDesc: Add budget lines to start tracking job costs by CSI division.
financial.createProjectFirst: Create a project first to start tracking job costs.
financial.chooseProjectDesc: Choose a project from the dropdown to view job costing.
financial.financialKpisDesc: Key performance indicators calculated from your financial data.
financial.currentRatioBenchmark: A ratio above 1.5 is considered healthy for construction companies. Below 1.0 indicates potential liquidity issues.
financial.quickRatioBenchmark: A quick ratio above 1.5 is strong. This excludes inventory and prepaid items for a stricter liquidity measure.
financial.workingCapitalBenchmark: Positive working capital means the company can cover its short-term liabilities. Negative indicates potential cash flow problems.
financial.grossMarginBenchmark: Construction companies typically target 20-35% gross margins. Below 15% may indicate pricing or cost control issues.
financial.netProfitMarginBenchmark: Healthy construction companies aim for 5-10% net profit margin. Above 10% is excellent.
financial.revenueGrowthFormula: (Current Period Revenue - Prior Period Revenue) / Prior Period Revenue x 100
financial.revenueGrowthBenchmark: Positive growth indicates expanding business. Compare against industry averages for context.
financial.dsoBenchmark: In construction, 30-45 days is typical. Over 60 days may indicate collection issues or unfavorable payment terms.
financial.dpoBenchmark: 30-45 days is common. Longer DPO preserves cash but may strain vendor relationships.
financial.debtToEquityBenchmark: Under 1:1 is conservative. Construction companies often operate at 1:1 to 2:1. Above 3:1 indicates high leverage.
financial.monthlyBurnRateFormula: Total Operating Expenses / Number of Months
financial.monthlyBurnRateBenchmark: Compare against revenue to ensure sustainability. Keep 3-6 months of burn rate in cash reserves.

import.title: Data Import
import.subtitle: Import your project data from Excel or CSV files
import.downloadMasterTemplateDesc: Download the Excel template with all sheets pre-formatted for import.
import.uploadMasterTemplateDesc: Upload a completed Excel workbook. All matching sheets will be imported at once.
import.clickToBrowse: Click to browse or drag & drop your Excel file
import.tip1: Download a template first to see the expected column format.
import.tip2: Date columns should use YYYY-MM-DD format.
import.tip3: Amount columns should contain numbers only (no $ signs or commas).
import.tip4: The first row must be the column header row.
import.noImportsDesc: Your import history will appear here after your first import.

cashFlowForecast.title: Cash Flow Forecast
cashFlowForecast.subtitle: 30/60/90-day cash position projections
cashFlowForecast.noFinancialDataDesc: Add bank accounts and invoices to generate cash flow forecasts. The forecast uses your current cash position, accounts receivable, and accounts payable to project future balances.
cashFlowForecast.assumptionsIntro: The forecast is generated using deterministic collection and payment rate assumptions applied to your current AR/AP aging buckets, plus monthly burn rate.
cashFlowForecast.burnRateNote: The monthly burn rate is computed as the average of your payable invoices over the last 3 months and is subtracted from each 30-day forecast period.

documents.title: Document AI

documents.configureProviderDoc: Configure an AI provider in Administration > AI Providers to enable document extraction.
documents.pasteHint: Paste the text content of your document below for AI extraction
documents.textareaPlaceholder: Paste the full text of your contract, insurance certificate, lien waiver, invoice, change order, permit, or other construction document here...
documents.noDocumentDesc: Select a document type, paste the text content of your construction document above, and click Extract Data to pull structured information using AI.

reports.centerSubtitle: Generate and view reports across projects, financials, properties, and workforce.
reports.authoritativeDesc: Generate investor-grade Market Feasibility Studies, Offering Memorandums, and Basis of Design documents with AI-powered narratives and magazine-quality PDF downloads.
reports.rptProjectPerformanceDesc: Budget variance, schedule status, and completion tracking across all active projects.
reports.rptBudgetVsActualDesc: Detailed comparison of budgeted amounts against actual costs by project and CSI division.
reports.rptScheduleAnalysisDesc: Timeline adherence, milestone tracking, and critical path analysis for active projects.
reports.rptFinancialSummaryDesc: Revenue, expenses, net income, AR/AP balances, and profit margin for the current fiscal period.
reports.rptArAgingDesc: Accounts receivable aging by bucket with outstanding invoice details.
reports.rptApAgingDesc: Accounts payable aging by bucket with vendor invoice details.
reports.rptCashFlowDesc: Monthly inflows and outflows with net cash position trending.
reports.rptPortfolioSummaryDesc: Occupancy rates, NOI, revenue, and cap rates across all properties.
reports.rptOccupancyAnalysisDesc: Unit-level occupancy trends, vacancy rates, and lease expiration timelines.
reports.rptProfitLossDesc: Detailed income and expenses breakdown from the financial overview page.
reports.rptRentRollDesc: Complete tenant listing with lease terms, monthly rent, and payment status.
reports.rptWorkforceSummaryDesc: Team headcount, role distribution, and project assignments overview.
reports.rptTimeAttendanceDesc: Hours logged, overtime tracking, and attendance patterns by team member.
reports.rptCertStatusDesc: License and certification tracking with expiration alerts and compliance status.
reports.agingSubtitle: Outstanding invoice aging analysis by time bucket.
reports.allPaidOrVoided: All receivable invoices are either paid or voided. No aging data to display.
reports.portfolioSubtitle: Occupancy, revenue, expenses, and NOI across all managed properties.

reports.perfSubtitle: Budget variance, schedule status, and completion tracking for all active projects.
reports.createProjectForReport: Create a project to see performance data in this report.
